page.title: 05CHURCHES AND CHAPELS
page.content: The church of St.Anne,Buck's Mills,was built over 100 years ago of local stone.The disused quarry is situated higher up the road.It is an Anglican church and is held in plurality with Clovelly and Woolsery parishes.The incubent lives at Clovelly rectory.The old vicarage is now a private house.Trundle cottage, near the slipway was once used as such and is a private dwelling.It has been the home of two artists for 20 years.The husband is a portrait painter,and his wife works in several media.A well-known stage designer has a home at Rose Cottage,on the Parkham side of the stream.The Cabin,on the slipway,has been the home of a water colour artist.
